channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pigeons nesting near seating area, 1st March
item.description:
Pigeons have been congregating near the seating area and bus stop at Bexleyheath Broadway which has led to quite a lot of them leaving behind droppings and it is affecting and restricting pedestrian movement within the town centre and these pigeons make it very difficult to move about in the space.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Broadway, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 1st March
item.description:
This drain is totally blocked and has been for more than two years. Reported often and nothing done to resolve. Flooding the street and flats.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Dufferin Street, Finsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Orange beacon cover loose, 1st March
item.description:
The message below was reported one month ago, and your response was: "The case has now been closed as our investigations have been completed and the necessary repairs arranged where it relates to items maintainable by Bexley. This may require replacement materials to be ordered or works needed by external agencies (such as UK Power Networks or Housing Association) which may then take up to 4 weeks. Please let us know if the matter is not resolved after 4 weeks." It is still not fixed, hence me contacting you again as suggested. The cover on the central zebra crossing light at Brampton Road has yet again moved round, meaning the light is now flashing directly in our bedrooms at night. Can this be rectified again, and make a more permanent fix than previous attempts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brecknock Rd the stretch between Leighton Rd and Camden Rd outside Butternilk and Bread by Bike, 1st March
item.description:
As a daily commuting cyclist this is treacherous. It’s impossible to merge into Brecknock from Leighton Rd in rush hour safely. These potholes will throw you off your bike. Only a matter of time til someone seriously injured.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Brecknock Road, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartmouth Park Hill, Highgate, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish and dumped items, 1st March
item.description:
Sides of East Dulwich station. Rail firm has responsibility for this land. It’s disgusting and will attract vermin. Please contact Southern and get it or whoever is responsible to clean it and keep it clean. If no action within a month from 1/03/26 I will escalate with MD and MP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Railway Rise, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Major potholes, 1st March
item.description:
There are numerous potholes along this stretch of road causing damage to cars and busses, this has been an ongoing problem that hasnt been resolved for many years and has got worse as time has gone on, its onky a matter of time before some serious damage is done or an injury

item.title: Flytipping, 1st March
item.description:
Yet again someone has seen fit to dump all manor of furniture items on the small grassed area as you enter Vincent Close. These arrived Saturday night Sunday morning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of furniture items, 1st March
item.description:
I have reported previously, fly tipping at this location and you have been more than helpful by clearing the site within 24 hrs and have also erected a ‘no fly tipping’ sign. However this morning Sunday 1st March I find an array of items which includes a sofa, sideboard, and other pieces of furniture have been abandoned! I’m not sure what the answer is to resolve this issue other than report it to you on every occasion it occurs. Please note the numerous for sale boards at the flats at the end of Vincent close!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vincent Close, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on grass verge, 1st March
item.description:
Still not been collected and grass bank in old Maidstone Road was cut with tractor last week but all the cans bottles rubbish was still left on the bank . Plus more rubbish has been added to the tyres ect on weekend please see pictures on opposite grass verge on corner of old Maidstone Road by A20

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maidstone Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
